items.title: Microsoft’s Satya Nadella is choosing chatbots over podcasts
items.description: While Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says he likes podcasts, he might not actually be listening to them anymore. That tidbit comes towards the end of a longer Bloomberg profile of Nadella, with a focus on Microsoft’s AI strategy and its complicated relationship with OpenAI. To illustrate how much he uses the company’s Copilot AI assistant in his daily life, Nadella said that instead of listening to podcasts, he now uploads the transcripts to Copilot, then talks to Copilot about the content during h

items.title: AI Daily: Nvidia says not sending GPU designs to China
items.description: Catch up on the top artificial intelligence news and commentary by Wall Street analysts on publicly traded companies in the space with this daily recap compiled by The Fly: NO GPU DESIGNS TO CHINA: Nvidia (NVDA) says it isn’t sending GPU plans to China following a report that the AI chipmaker is working on a research and development center in Shanghai, CNBC’s Samantha Subin reports. The Financial Times had previously reported that Nvidia is looking to build a research and development center in S

items.title: Anthropic closes $2.5B credit facility, CNBC reports
items.description: Earlier this week, Anthropic received a $2.5B, five-year revolving credit line to amp up its liquidity in an ever-expanding – and expensive – competition in the artificial intelligence industry, CNBC’s Hayden Field reports. Anthropic, founded by former OpenAI research executives, launched its Claude chatbot in March 2023. The company closed its latest funding round in March at a $61.5B valuation, and the new credit facility adds to that, the author notes. The generative AI market is poised to to

items.title: Microsoft's Layoffs Come As The Company Is Racing To Automate Various Roles With AI - The Information
items.description: May 17 - * MICROSOFT’S LAYOFFS COME AS THE COMPANY IS RACING TOAUTOMATEVARIOUS ROLES WITH AI - THE INFORMATION * MICROSOFT’S AUTOMATION IS PART OF A STRATEGY TO SELL...

items.title: Charter to combine with Cox, Take-Two reports mixed Q4 results: Morning Buzz
items.description: The major averages were little changed near noon following the release of downbeat consumer sentiment data and as April housing starts came in slightly below consensus estimates. Investors continue to weigh potentially easing trade tensions as well. Meanwhile, President Trump said in a post on Truth Social that Republican lawmakers “must unite” to pass his “beautiful” tax bill.
